derivation: a primitive root; also as denominative from H1198 (בַּעַר)
outline:
1. to burn, consume, kindle, be kindled
    1. (Qal)
      1. to begin to burn, be kindled, start burning
      2. to burn, be burning
      3. to burn, consume
      4. Jehovah's wrath, human wrath (fig.)
    2. (Piel)
      1. to kindle, burn
      2. to consume, remove (of guilt) (fig.)
    3. (Hiphil)
      1. to kindle
      2. to burn up
      3. to consume (destroy)
    4. (Pual) to burn
  2. to be stupid, brutish, barbarous
    1. (Qal) to be stupid, dull-hearted, unreceptive
    2. (Niphal) to be stupid, dull-hearted
    3. (Piel) to feed, graze
    4. (Hiphil) to cause to be grazed over
kjv_def: be brutish, bring (put, take) away, burn, (cause to) eat (up), feed, heat, kindle, set (on fire), waste.
strongs_def: to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
